page.title: 14MARKET GARDENING
page.content: MARKET GARDENING The land in this area is classified as having the best soil in Britain and it is therefore very intensively used. Instead of big fields with hedgerows here we have many smallholdings. Instead of talking about farmers and their farms we refer to growers and their ground. All types of fresh vegetables are grown as you can see on photo C. We have a lot of glasshouses and polythene tunnels and most growers use irrigation sprays and lots of fertilisers. This does spoil the landscape as there are many sheds and hardly any trees or hedgerows. Some of the orchards have been grubbed out because cheaper fruit is coming from Europe.
